body_html:
When you do this, it makes it very hard on packagers to keep up with your releases and to guarantee users that they're getting a validated version of Tensorflow. The update process sounds like it's not transactional.

What should really happen in situations like this is that the cherry pick should go out as a point release. That way packagers have a way to differentiate the versions and checksums.
body_text:
When you do this, it makes it very hard on packagers to keep up with your releases and to guarantee users that they're getting a validated version of Tensorflow.  The update process sounds like it's not transactional.
What should really happen in situations like this is that the cherry pick should go out as a point release.  That way packagers have a way to differentiate the versions and checksums.
body:
When you do this, it makes it very hard on packagers to keep up with your releases and to guarantee users that they're getting a validated version of Tensorflow.  The update process sounds like it's not transactional.

What should really happen in situations like this is that the cherry pick should go out as a point release.  That way packagers have a way to differentiate the versions and checksums.
